title: Truelove and Witts Severity Index for Ulcerative Colitis
description: Stratifies severity of ulcerative colitis into mild, moderate, or severe categories based on clinical and laboratory parameters

parameters.name: bowel_movements
parameters.description: Number of bowel movements per day

parameters.name: blood_in_stool
parameters.description: Presence and severity of blood in stool

parameters.name: tachycardia
parameters.description: Pulse greater than 90 beats per minute

parameters.name: anemia
parameters.description: Presence of anemia (hemoglobin ≤10.5 g/dL or 105 g/L)

parameters.name: esr_elevated
parameters.description: Erythrocyte sedimentation rate greater than 30 mm/hr

ranges.interpretation: Mild disease with minimal systemic symptoms. Can usually be managed with topical or oral aminosalicylates. Monitor closely for response to treatment.
Moderate disease with some systemic symptoms. Consider oral corticosteroids or immunomodulators. May require hospitalization for monitoring and treatment optimization.

Severe disease with significant systemic symptoms. Requires immediate hospitalization and intensive medical therapy. Consider intravenous corticosteroids, biologics, or surgical consultation. Monitor for complications such as toxic megacolon or perforation.

references: Truelove SC, Witts LJ. Cortisone in ulcerative colitis; final report on a therapeutic trial. Br Med J. 1955;2(4947):1041-8. PMID: 13260656; PMCID: PMC2061071.
Danese S, Fiocchi C. Ulcerative colitis. N Engl J Med. 2011 Nov 3;365(18):1713-25. doi: 10.1056/NEJMra1102942.
Rubin DT, Ananthakrishnan AN, Siegel CA, Sauer BG, Long MD. ACG Clinical Guideline: Ulcerative Colitis in Adults. Am J Gastroenterol. 2019 Mar;114(3):384-413. doi: 10.14309/ajg.0000000000000152.
formula: Classification based on presence of criteria: Mild = all criteria for mild severity met (bowel movements <4, no/small blood, no fever, pulse ≤90, no anemia, ESR ≤30); Severe = ≥6 bowel movements AND ≥1 systemic feature (fever, tachycardia, anemia); Moderate = between mild and severe criteria
notes: The index was originally developed in 1955 as part of the first clinical trial demonstrating effectiveness of cortisone in ulcerative colitis
Anemia is defined as hemoglobin ≤10.5 g/dL (105 g/L)
This index is widely used for initial assessment and clinical trials but should be combined with endoscopic findings for comprehensive evaluation
Severe classification requires urgent medical attention and possible hospitalization
